title: Lars Dornfeld
text:
I‚Äôm Lars Dornfeld, a scientist interested in structural bioinformatics, protein design, and computational biology. I started in the wet lab, working on protein engineering and chemical biology, before transitioning to computational methods, focusing on machine learning for protein design and molecular dynamics to study cyclic peptides.
Feel free to explore my work ‚Äî thanks for stopping by!

  
    

    
  
     ü¶ã Bluesky
  
  
    
     Github
  

  
  
I am an incoming PhD student in the Biomolecular Design group at the Max Planck Institute for Biochemistry in Munich. My research will focus on enzyme design tools and applied projects, working at the interface of computational and experimental methods.
I‚Äôll be co-advised by Dr.¬†Lukas Milles and Prof.¬†Dr.¬†Karsten Borgwardt, combining expertise from both fields to develop innovative approaches in biomolecular design.

title: Lars Dornfeld
text:
I‚Äôm Lars Dornfeld, a scientist interested in structural bioinformatics, protein design, and computational biology. I started in the wet lab, working on protein engineering and chemical biology, before transitioning to computational methods, focusing on machine learning for protein design and molecular dynamics to study cyclic peptides.
Feel free to explore my work ‚Äî thanks for stopping by!

  
    

    
  
     ü¶ã Bluesky
  
  
    
     Github
  

  
  
I am an incoming PhD student in the Biomolecular Design group at the Max Planck Institute for Biochemistry in Munich. My research will focus on enzyme design tools and applied projects, working at the interface of computational and experimental methods.
I‚Äôll be co-advised by Dr.¬†Lukas Milles and Prof.¬†Dr.¬†Karsten Borgwardt, combining expertise from both fields to develop innovative approaches in biomolecular design.

ETH Z√ºrich, Prof.¬†Sereina Riniker (Apr.¬†2024 ‚Äì Dec.¬†2024)

Applied enhanced sampling molecular dynamics to study cyclic peptide permeability and structure-activity relationships.

Developed computational workflows integrating GROMACS, PLUMED, and RDKit for molecular simulations.

Conducted statistical physics-based analysis to interpret simulation outcomes.
Proposed several variants with improved permeability profiles.

Skills:


Molecular Dynamics (MD) Enhanced Sampling Techniques GROMACS PLUMED RDKit Computational Chemistry Statistical Physics




IBMB Barcelona, Dr.¬†Noelia Ferruz (Jun.¬†2023 ‚Äì Oct.¬†2023)

Trained and optimized large language models (LLMs) to generate small-molecule binding proteins.
Implemented and fine-tuned transformer architectures on high-performance computing (HPC) clusters.

Limited success due to limited data availability and model overfitting.
Presented research findings at the 2nd European Rosettacon.

Skills:


Machine Learning (ML) Protein Language Models Transformer Models HuggingFace High-Performance Computing (HPC) Git & Version Control




EPFL Lausanne, Prof.¬†Bruno E. Correia (Oct.¬†2022 ‚Äì Feb.¬†2023)

Engineered AlphaFold & proteinMPNN-driven sequence designs for soluble analogs of membrane proteins.

Conducted medium-throughput protein expression and validated designs via X-ray crystallography and biophysical characterization.

Applied CD Spectroscopy and SEC-MALS to assess protein folding and stability.

Designed soluble analogues with native scaffolds.


Structural Bioinformatics Computational Protein Design AlphaFold X-ray Crystallography CD Spectroscopy SEC-MALS Protein Expression & Purification




Max-Planck Institute, Prof.¬†Kai Johnsson (Nov.¬†2021 ‚Äì Jul.¬†2022, Mar.¬†2023 ‚Äì Jun.¬†2023)

Characterized and engineered rhodamine-binding proteins for super-resolution microscopy applications.
Developed a computational protein-engineering pipeline to optimize binding properties and stability.


Protein Expression Molecular Cloning Yeast Display ITC & FP Assays Molecular Docking
